thread.title: Los Angeles airport votes for uber, lyft passenger pickups
thread.title_full: Los Angeles airport votes for uber, lyft passenger pickups

title: Los Angeles airport votes for uber, lyft passenger pickups
text:
Los Angeles airport votes for uber, lyft passenger pickups Last updated 10:13, July 17 2015 KAI PFAFFENBACH/REUTERS 
LA is moving towards allowing services like Uber to pick up passengers at the airport. 
Los Angeles has moved toward becoming the biggest city in the US to allow ride-hailing services like Uber and Lyft to pick up passengers at the airport. 
Despite protests from taxi drivers who picketed the meeting, officials from Los Angeles International Airport voted in favour of the change. 
Pickups could begin as early as August, but the plan is still subject to final approval from the airport and the city attorney. 
The Los Angeles Times reports the proposal includes a digital "fence" that would tell the airport when a driver from one of the services enters or leaves the terminal area. 
Currently, the drivers are allowed to drop off passengers but not pick them up. Under the proposed changes, they'd have to pay a US$4 (NZ$6) fee to do either.
